00153    #ifdef UTIL_MPI
00154    /*
00155    * Set the param communicator.
00156    */
00157    template <typename Data>
00158    void Factory<Data>::setParamCommunicator(MPI::Intracomm& communicator)
00159    {
00160       if (paramFileIo_.hasCommunicator()) {
00161          if (&paramFileIo_.communicator() != &communicator) {
00162             UTIL_THROW("Attempt to modify Factory param communicator");
00163          }
00164       } else {
00165          paramFileIo_.setCommunicator(communicator);
00166       }
00167    }
00168 
00169    /*
00170    * Does thus factory have a param communicator?
00171    */
00172    template <typename Data>
00173    bool Factory<Data>::hasParamCommunicator() const
00174    {  return paramFileIo_.hasCommunicator(); }
00175    #endif
00176 
00177    /*
00178    * Add a subfactory to the list of children.
00179    */
00180    template <typename Data>
00181    void Factory<Data>::addSubfactory(Factory<Data>& subfactory)
00182    {  subfactories_.push_back(&subfactory); }
00183 
00184    /*
00185    * Read subclass name, create object, and read its parameters.
00186    */
00187    template <typename Data>
00188    Data* Factory<Data>::readObject(std::istream &in, ParamComposite& parent,
00189                                    std::string& className, bool& isEnd)
00190    {
00191       std::string  commentString;
00192       Data*        typePtr = 0;
00193       int          length;
00194       bool         hasData = false; // initialized to avoid compiler warning
00195 
00196       #ifdef UTIL_MPI
00197       // Set paramCommunicator to that of parent, if any.
00198       if (parent.hasParamCommunicator()) {
00199          setParamCommunicator(parent.paramCommunicator());
00200       }
00201       #endif
00202 
00203       // Read a first line of the form "ClassName{"
00204       if (paramFileIo_.isIoProcessor()) {
00205          in >> commentString;
00206       }
00207       #ifdef UTIL_MPI
00208       // Broadcast the full string to all processors.
00209       if (paramFileIo_.hasCommunicator()) {
00210          bcast<std::string>(paramFileIo_.communicator(), commentString, 0);
00211       }
00212       // Hereafter, each processor independently processes the same string.
00213       #endif
00214       length = commentString.size();
00215 
00216       // If commentString = '}', set isEnd=true and return null ptr.
00217       if (length == 1 && commentString[0] == '}') {
00218          className = std::string();
00219          isEnd = true;
00220          return 0; 
00221       } else {
00222          isEnd = false;
00223       }
00224 
00225       // Isolate className by stripping the trailing "{" bracket
00226       if (commentString[length-1] == '{') {
00227          className = commentString.substr(0, commentString.size() - 1);
00228          hasData = true;
00229       } else
00230       if (commentString[length-1] == '}') {
00231          className = commentString.substr(0, commentString.size() - 2);
00232          hasData = false;
00233       } else {
00234          if (paramFileIo_.isIoProcessor()) {
00235             Log::file() << "commentString = " << commentString << std::endl;
00236             Log::file() << "className     = " << className     << std::endl;
00237             UTIL_THROW("Invalid first line\n");
00238          }
00239       }
00240 
00241       // Create new object of the specified class.
00242       typePtr = factory(className);
00243 
00244       // If the subclass name was recognized:
00245       if (typePtr) {
00246 
00247          // Add Begin object to new child ParamComposite, indented for child.
00248          Begin* beginPtr;
00249          beginPtr = &typePtr->addBegin(className.c_str());
00250          beginPtr->setIndent(parent);
00251 
00252          // Echo Begin object, if appropriate
00253          if (ParamComponent::echo() && paramFileIo_.isIoProcessor()) {
00254             beginPtr->writeParam(Log::file());
00255          }
00256 
00257          // Read parameters for the new child object, if any
00258          if (hasData) {
00259             parent.readParamComposite(in, *typePtr);
00260          }
00261 
00262          // Read closing bracket, set indentation as for child.
00263          typePtr->readEnd(in).setIndent(parent);
00264 
00265          // Note: The readParam() methods for managed objects should not
00266          // read begin and end lines, since these are instead read here.
00267 
00268       }
00269       return typePtr;
00270    }
00271 
00272    /*
00273    * Try all subfactories in sequence searching for a match.
00274    */
00275    template <typename Data>
00276    Data* Factory<Data>::trySubfactories(const std::string& className) const
00277    {
00278       Data* typePtr = 0;
00279       int n = subfactories_.size();
00280       for (int i = 0; i < n && typePtr == 0; ++i) {
00281          typePtr = subfactories_[i]->factory(className);
00282       }
00283       return typePtr;
00284    }
00285 
00286 }
00287 #endif
